task.summary: Default task
Obtained translations for 'wave factor'
Finished list of ref text, part 1

Swapped the order of units, Paragraph first, splitting texts into segments, or not, then RefList parsing to spit out references, then for each piece of text, apply the sentence.py (SR) rules on it and translate.
Corrected the translation for splitting lines up in paragraph.py, also corrected the translateQuoted() when no translations can be obtained

Thought of a method for swapping references, using a numeric mnemonic replacements in places of reference, storing the list of mnemonic after the translation is completed by first found location of the mnemonics in the translation string, then replace them with the translation texts of refs. The code runs SLOW!

Thought of a method for swapping references, using a numeric mnemonic replacements in places of reference, storing the list of mnemonic after the translation is completed by first found location of the mnemonics in the translation string, then replace them with the translation texts of refs. The code runs SLOW!

Thought of a method for swapping references, using a numeric mnemonic replacements in places of reference, storing the list of mnemonic after the translation is completed by first found location of the mnemonics in the translation string, then replace them with the translation texts of refs. The code runs SLOW!

Thought of a method for swapping references, using a numeric mnemonic replacements in places of reference, storing the list of mnemonic after the translation is completed by first found location of the mnemonics in the translation string, then replace them with the translation texts of refs. The code runs SLOW!
Changed how to masks for references are made, using index + &&, this has produced a reduction from 10 secs to 0.73 secs.
Corrected the translation for Ref with links, reflist.py, remove abbrev if there is one
Added translations and ignores upto 'DolphinDream'
Corrected error in not recognizing leading (e.g.) when splitting, due to difference cases of letters
Re-enable match case at end stage, translateOneText() in reflist.py, but not sure if this is a wise decision or not
added translations upto 'monado'
added translations upto 'Samples: 8'
added translations upto 'Samples: 8' plus add ability to check for translated versions first before actually committed to SR
added translations upto 'Samples: 8' plus add ability to check for translated versions first before actually committed to SR
Correct a mistake in the collectTranslationsFromRefRecords, reflist.py, which doesn't return the translation result

Change the order of splitting sentences, so this action occurs at the translating, after parsing has been completed, which removes the presence of refs, avoiding the splitting errors, which could occurs in the middle of a reference entry
Corrected the error in 'not has_ref' situation, too many expected return values
Cleaned up the translateRefWithLink in reflist.py, removed redundant codes. Translated to 'as you can see it in the..'
Translated to 'below resolution controls..'
Change sorting to use dict_sl_txt rather than pattern in createSentenceStructureDict of nocasedict.py
Translated to 'by specifying an object to use'
Fixed an error in the translateOneLineOfText, returning a tuple instead of a single string
Fixed the returning values of translateOneLineOfText in reflist.py. The code IS REALLY slow

Attaching profile (using @profile) above the def test_translate_0001 in test_py.py. Also cleaned up the nocasedict.py, using ordinary dictionary, use list comprehension to lower the data before putting data into the dictionary, using parameter switch to flag when this is required. Extract and store the sentence structure to a separate JSON file, ref_dict_ss_0001.json (backup in ref_dict_ss_0002.json). Removed '${' entries from the ref_dict_0006_0003.json.
Trying to replace the sentence structure dictionary with a manually selected list of required structure. Before considering a new method for working out best matched structure to use
Added getTypeLoc() in matcher.py, also working out how to cleaned up the sentence structure dict entries to try creating something similar to looking up the fuzzy dicts, using binarySearch()
Back to test_translate_0001
Corrected the dict_keys, conversion to list(self.keys)
Corrected the lowercase requirement when searching refs in dictionary in replaceTranRef, nocasedict.py
Tried the simplified method, doesn't work, so reverted back to the older method, using ss_map in definition.py, and enter (ss_key, value) sets manually as needed

Tried the simplified method, doesn't work, so reverted back to the older method, using ss_map in definition.py, and enter (ss_key, value) sets manually as needed. Inserted camtasia_9_product_keys.txt and the Text Substitutions_plist

Translation terms upto 'drags'. Note changes in translation for 'damping' must be done in po file to distinguish three different forces: "deceleration, friction, dampening": ":abbr:`giảm tốc (deceleration)`, :abbr:`lực ma sát (friction)`, :abbr:`lực giảm chấn (dampening)`",
Translation terms upto 'extruded'
Translation terms upto 'human perception'
Translation terms upto 'i.e. Bézier with Bézier, NURBS with NURBS'

Corrected the way correctIndexOfTLTextList() working out the new locations, by forcefully adding df.FILLER_CHAR after text segments when composing the dict_tl_txt with any_txt. Use findInvert(df.FILLER_CHAR_PATTERN) should be able to work out the correct new location of texts.

Corrected the error where references lost leading and trailing spaces when reattach to the translation at the end, by uisng 'SPACE' for blank_str in the correctIndexOfTLTextList() (sentence.py) instead of FILLER_CHAR. Using FILLER_CHAR for joining segments only, so we can remove the FILLER_CHARs by empties later on.

Corrected the parsing errors using patterns in recognizing sentence structures, especially with 'ED(ies)', for instance, where parsing returns the 'ies' as a separate entry in the result, which is wrong, when the intention is to recognise such a word with ending 'ies', but expecting returning the whole word. Achieving this by setting Common.patStructToListOfWords(key, removing_symbols=False) in the creatSentRecogniserPattern() in common.py, forcing the space characters becomes the vital part of the pattern created.
Translated to 'in the *Cloth* panel'
Fixed the error in translateRefWithLink() where the output was not as expected when ref has link. Translated to 'of the translation, scale, and, rotation values'
Translated to '"only in linear bending model'
Translated to 'overlay icon'
Translated to 'quite useful in game development and architecture areas'
Translated to 'rotation of RGB vectors'
Translated to 'side views'
Translated to 'typically, a linked character'

MESSAGE.value: Attaching profile (using @profile) above the def test_translate_0001 in test_py.py. Also cleaned up the nocasedict.py, using ordinary dictionary, use list comprehension to lower the data before putting data into the dictionary, using parameter switch to flag when this is required. Extract and store the sentence structure to a separate JSON file, ref_dict_ss_0001.json (backup in ref_dict_ss_0002.json). Removed '${' entries from the ref_dict_0006_0003.json.
Trying to replace the sentence structure dictionary with a manually selected list of required structure. Before considering a new method for working out best matched structure to use
Added getTypeLoc() in matcher.py, also working out how to cleaned up the sentence structure dict entries to try creating something similar to looking up the fuzzy dicts, using binarySearch()
Back to test_translate_0001
Corrected the dict_keys, conversion to list(self.keys)
Corrected the lowercase requirement when searching refs in dictionary in replaceTranRef, nocasedict.py
Tried the simplified method, doesn't work, so reverted back to the older method, using ss_map in definition.py, and enter (ss_key, value) sets manually as needed

Tried the simplified method, doesn't work, so reverted back to the older method, using ss_map in definition.py, and enter (ss_key, value) sets manually as needed. Inserted camtasia_9_product_keys.txt and the Text Substitutions_plist
Translation terms upto 'drags'

Translation terms upto 'drags'. Note changes in translation for 'damping' must be done in po file to distinguish three different forces: "deceleration, friction, dampening": ":abbr:`giảm tốc (deceleration)`, :abbr:`lực ma sát (friction)`, :abbr:`lực giảm chấn (dampening)`",
Translation terms upto 'extruded'
Translation terms upto 'human perception'
Translation terms upto 'i.e. Bézier with Bézier, NURBS with NURBS'

Corrected the way correctIndexOfTLTextList() working out the new locations, by forcefully adding df.FILLER_CHAR after text segments when composing the dict_tl_txt with any_txt. Use findInvert(df.FILLER_CHAR_PATTERN) should be able to work out the correct new location of texts.

Corrected the error where references lost leading and trailing spaces when reattach to the translation at the end, by uisng 'SPACE' for blank_str in the correctIndexOfTLTextList() (sentence.py) instead of FILLER_CHAR. Using FILLER_CHAR for joining segments only, so we can remove the FILLER_CHARs by empties later on.

Corrected the parsing errors using patterns in recognizing sentence structures, especially with 'ED(ies)', for instance, where parsing returns the 'ies' as a separate entry in the result, which is wrong, when the intention is to recognise such a word with ending 'ies', but expecting returning the whole word. Achieving this by setting Common.patStructToListOfWords(key, removing_symbols=False) in the creatSentRecogniserPattern() in common.py, forcing the space characters becomes the vital part of the pattern created.
Translated to 'in the *Cloth* panel'
Fixed the error in translateRefWithLink() where the output was not as expected when ref has link. Translated to 'of the translation, scale, and, rotation values'
Translated to '"only in linear bending model'
Translated to 'overlay icon'
Translated to 'quite useful in game development and architecture areas'
Translated to 'rotation of RGB vectors'
Translated to 'side views'
Translated to 'surface overrides'
Translated to 'typically, a linked character'
